properties.prefix:
Mechanism


  • There are specific field-sets for recommended aspects of description. The “type” sub-field is used to fine tune the meaning, the “value” sub-field is used to indicate a key-word or phrase for that aspect, and the “note” sub-field is used for a longer text which amplifies the meaning or indicates a special consideration.

  • If there is no specific field-set for your purpose, use “keyword” for typed descriptive words or phrases and “note” for typed descriptive texts.

properties.description: The required name, label or formal title of the mechanism or equipment being described. This is the primary way of naming the mechanism in the system.
properties.title: Primary Title

properties.description: Use this if there are other names or titles associated with the mechanism in the context of your research.
properties.title: Alternate Titles

properties.description: The type of alternate title such as Abbreviation.
properties.title: Alternate Title Type

properties.description: This is a general description or abstract about what you know about the instrument deployment.
properties.title: Summary Description

properties.description: Keywords, subject terms, key phrases classification codes, etc., ideally drawn from a thesaurus, which classifies or describes themechanism and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The type of keyword, such as Subject, Geographic or Temporal. Leaving type blank would imply general keywords.
properties.title: Keyword Type

properties.description: The type of mechanism or equipment being described such as a camera or sensor.
properties.title: Mechanism Type

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the mechanism type being described.
properties.title: Mechanism Type Notes

properties.description: Formal strings of characters that are used to uniquely identify the mechanism in various systems. This can also be used to create a formal identifier for the mechanism for your project.
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: The name of the system or standard for which the identifier was created.
properties.title: Identifier Type

properties.description: A standard identifier for the mechanism.
properties.title: Identifier

properties.description: This is the statement of different kinds of rights that are asserted for the mechanism information. This can include such things as access rights, credit lines, etc.
properties.title: Rights

properties.description: The type of rights being described such as Access or Use Rights.
properties.title: Rights Type

properties.description: A description of the rights surrounding the mechanism.
properties.title: Rights

properties.description: Other entities that are related to the mechanism, such as the name of a larger project to which the mechanism being described was a part.
properties.title: Relations

properties.description: The type of related item such as a project, publication or website.
properties.title: Related Item Type

properties.description: The unique identifier for the related item.
properties.title: Related Item ID

properties.description: General notes that provide descriptions for other aspects relevant to your understanding of the mechanism, such as general notes, etc., and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: The type of note such as Field Notes, General Notes, etc.
properties.title: Note Type

properties.description: This can be used to register specific dates associated with the mechanism, such as the manufacture date.
properties.title: Time Period

properties.description: The type of Time Period being described such as manufacture date or date calibrated.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date associated with the time period being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin date or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Current or historical spatial location information about the mechanism being described, such as place that the mechanism was produced.
properties.title: Place Information

properties.description: The type of place being described such as the storage location or manufacture location.
properties.title: Place Type

properties.description: Name of a geographic location pertaining to the entity being described e.g. Country, Province, Region, etc.
properties.title: Geographic Areas

properties.description: This is used to identify the time period during which the place is relevant to the mechanism.
properties.title: Place Time Period

properties.description: The type of date related to the place.
properties.title: Place Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date or dates associated with the place being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the place being described.
properties.title: Place Notes

properties.description: This is used to identify people or organizations which have a special relationship to the mechanism. For example, the person who calibrated or installed the mechanism.
properties.title: Related People and Organizations

properties.description: The role of a person associated with the mechanism.
properties.title: Person Role

properties.description: The name of a person associated with the instrument deployment.
properties.title: Person Name

properties.description: The role of the organization related to the mechanism, such as “funder” or “owner”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.title: Organization Name

properties.description: Used to describe general physical characteristics of the mechansim.
properties.title: Physical Description

properties.description: The type of physical characteristic being described.
properties.title: Physical Description Type

properties.description: Used to describe the observed state of the mechanism.
properties.title: Condition

properties.description: The type of condition being described.
properties.title: Condition Type

properties.description: The format or media type of the mechanism.
properties.title: Format

properties.description: Describe any relevant treatments pertaining to the mechanism such as maintenance events.
properties.title: Treatment

properties.description: The type of treatment used.
properties.title: Treatment Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the treatment.
properties.title: Treatment

properties.description: Numeric measurements pertaining to the mechanism.
properties.title: Measurements

properties.description: This is for cases where the measurements are just a string of text. For example, “L 12 inches; H 6 inches”.
properties.title: Measurement Text

properties.description: The type of measurement such as depth, circumference, length, width or height.
properties.title: Measurement Type

properties.description: The value of the measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Value

properties.description: Unit of measurement such as feet, inches, centimeters, etc.
properties.title: Measurement Unit

properties.description: The type of date being described.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date associated with the entity being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin date or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Explanatory text on the accuracy of the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Accuracy
